Outfit Parts Overhaul changes how maintenance works, placing greater emphasis on using the right tools and parts to maintain your equipment.
 
 %c[pda_green]I. Parts and Maintenance%c[ui_gray_1]
 
• Outfits have a maximum condition. This is determined by the average condition of their parts. 
• Outfit repair items work from 0%, however, they can only restore up to the max condition. 
• Heavier armors need stronger repair items. 
• Technicians will restore all parts to 100%. 
• Damage taken by the suit over time degrades max condition. Different parts degrade at different speeds. 
 
 %c[pda_green]II. Repair and workshop changes%c[ui_gray_1]
 
• Certain repair items (sewing kits and repair kits) repair the parts in the suit. This in turn restores max condition. 
• Basic sewing kits can fix fabrics. Advanced and heavy sewing kits can fix retardants and fabrics. Repair kits fix everything but helmets. 
• Each kit restores a variable amount of condition, prioritizing the parts it can repair first. For example, in a suit with equally damaged ballistic, retardant, and fabric components, the ballistics take priority. 
• By themselves, sewing and repair kits restore very little max condition. Outfit parts can be used as support items for repair to greatly enhance max condition restored. 
• Use a 100% part that is used in the suit to maximize part condition restored (up to 3x!). 
• Workshop replacement of parts does not restore max condition. To compensate, it is free and doesn't consume charges of repair kit. 
 
 %c[pda_green]III. Armor Ripper%c[ui_gray_1]
 
• You can disassemble outfit parts to get base components! 
• To disassemble, use an appropriate tool or drag-drop a tool onto a part. 
• Condition affects amount of components you get. 
• Outfit part components are used to assemble other outfit parts. The recipes are distributed amongst Advanced Kit books.
